sentences.sContent: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
sentences.sCn: 黛娜一边哭一边慢慢地开车走了。

sentences.sContent: ...a little knowledge concerned with some people called a hardship into an enjoyable stay away from the troubles of modern society...
...they tended to turn away their gaze...
...even the saddest moments can be washed away with time...
...The Urbanization — migration away from the suburbs to the city center — will be the biggest real estate trend in 2015...
...I always make sure the third one gets something because I can't drive away and have that third one not have something...
...Time to put away my gloves and boots...
...Then he'll be away in New York...
...who have since been drawn away by Citi Bikes...
...and though a few of these educational institutions are giving the hardware away for free...

trans.tranOther: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person
